{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3494932,"name":"crollison","username":"crollison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T18:54:35.573Z","cooked":"

Mentor here, last year for the team and no coder. I have exposure, but not competent. I’m just trying to get my team through this season with a good chance. We moved to Java 2 years ago from Labview (I understood Labview better, but hard to get help with it). I posted here earlier about help and people pointed me to AdvantageKit and it honestly looks like it would be our best bet, especially where vision is already coded in.

I imported it and went through the steps listed, we use Spark Max’s for our drive motors and a do have a NavX on board, so I think I made the correct code changes for those issues. I changed the CAN ID’s to match our CAN ID’s, but after deploying to our testbot I’m getting CAN SPARK errors, (ERROR 4,[CAN SPARK] IDs: 4,10, WPLib or External HAL Error: CAN: Message not found Periodic Status 0

We also will be using a LimeLight, albiet it’s version1.

Here is our code if anyone could look at it and see what I’m doing wrong. Thanks so much in advance.

github.com

GitHub - blackknight4809/2025Advantage

Contribute to blackknight4809/2025Advantage development by creating an account on GitHub.

Are all the SparkMaxs running latest firmware.
Use REV Client to check.
If you need to upgrade anything I would not apply power to the SparkMaxes and check them out 1 by 1 using only a USB-C cable at first.

Looking at the code, look like you are using the latest REVLib version, so that’s good.

Those errors are usually CAN IDs not being set properly. Your code is requesting information from a CAN ID that is not recognized physically on the robot.

So make sure the CAN IDs you have set on the SparkMaxes match your code.

Using REV Client and updated speed controllers, once the robot is on and properly wired you should be able to see all the speed controllers at once.

All SparkMaxes are current, 24.01 I believe.

I think current is 2025.0.3

When the robot is powered on an in what should be a normal operating state, and you plug in a USB-C cable to one of the sparkmaxes then fire up the REV client, can you see all the SparkMaxes on the CAN bus?

That is goal #1, then making sure the CAN Ids all match what you have set up in code.
